title: Fullstack Todo Template
description: Production-ready React + Node.js Todo app template with MongoDB, JWT auth, and AWS integration
---

# Fullstack Todo Template

The Fullstack Todo template provides a complete, production-ready React + Node.js application with MongoDB, JWT authentication, dark/light mode, and full AWS integration.

![TodoApp Architecture](/assets/todoapp-architecture.svg)

<CardGroup cols={3}>
  <Card title="Frontend" icon="react">
    React 18 + Vite + Ant Design + Tailwind CSS
  </Card>
  <Card title="Backend" icon="server">
    Node.js + Express + JWT Authentication
  </Card>
  <Card title="Database" icon="database">
    MongoDB (local) / MongoDB Atlas / PostgreSQL
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## Tech Stack

### Frontend

- **React 18** - Modern React with hooks
- **Vite** - Fast build tool and dev server
- **Ant Design** - UI component library with dark mode
- **Tailwind CSS** - Utility-first CSS framework
- **React Router** - Client-side routing
- **Axios** - HTTP client for API calls

### Backend

- **Node.js** - JavaScript runtime
- **Express** - Web framework
- **Mongoose** - MongoDB ODM
- **JWT** - JSON Web Token authentication
- **bcrypt** - Password hashing
- **Joi** - Input validation

### Database

- **MongoDB** - NoSQL database (local development)
- **MongoDB Atlas** - Managed MongoDB (production option)
- **PostgreSQL** - SQL database (alternative)

## Features

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card title="Authentication" icon="user-lock">
    User registration and login with JWT tokens
  </Card>
  <Card title="CRUD Operations" icon="list-check">
    Complete Create, Read, Update, Delete for todos
  </Card>
  <Card title="Dark/Light Mode" icon="moon">
    Theme toggle with system preference detection
  </Card>
  <Card title="User-Specific Todos" icon="user">
    Each user sees only their own todos
  </Card>
  <Card title="Enhanced Todos" icon="star">
    Priority, due dates, tags, categories, subtasks
  </Card>
  <Card title="Statistics" icon="chart-bar">
    User productivity tracking and completion rates
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## User Interface

The TodoApp features a modern, intuitive interface with comprehensive task management capabilities:



**Key UI Features:**
- **Modern Design**: Clean, responsive interface built with Ant Design components
- **Dark/Light Theme**: Automatic theme switching with system preference detection
- **Task Organization**: Categorize tasks with tags, priorities, and due dates
- **Progress Tracking**: Visual progress indicators and completion statistics
- **Real-time Updates**: Live synchronization across all connected devices
- **Linear Integration**: Seamless connection to Linear for advanced project management

## Local Development

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18+
- Docker (to run MongoDB locally) or local MongoDB server
- npm or yarn

### Start MongoDB with Docker

```bash
docker run -d --name todoapp-mongo -p 27017:27017 \
  -e MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME=root \
  -e MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD=example \
  mongo:7
```

<Note>
For a MongoDB server without authentication, use: `MONGO_URI=mongodb://localhost:27017/todoapp`
</Note>

### Environment Variables

Create `backend/.env`:

<CodeGroup>
```bash Development
JWT_SECRET=dev-secret-change-me-in-production
PORT=5000
NODE_ENV=development
FRONTEND_URL=http://localhost:5174
MONGO_URI=mongodb://root:example@localhost:27017/todoapp?authSource=admin
```

```bash Production (AWS)
JWT_SECRET_ARN=arn:aws:secretsmanager:region:account-id:secret:todoapp/jwt/secret-xxxxx
DB_SECRET_ARN=arn:aws:secretsmanager:region:account-id:secret:todoapp/database/credentials-xxxxx
AWS_REGION=us-east-1
PORT=5000
NODE_ENV=production
FRONTEND_URL=https://your-domain.com
SERVICE_NAME=todo-api
```
</CodeGroup>

### Run Backend

```bash
cd golden-path/templates/fullstack-todo/backend
npm install
npm start
```

**Health Check**: `http://localhost:5000/health`

### Run Frontend

```bash
cd golden-path/templates/fullstack-todo/frontend
npm install
npm run dev -- --port 5174
```

**App URL**: `http://localhost:5174`

### API Proxy

The frontend proxies API requests via Vite configuration:

```javascript
// vite.config.js
server: {
  proxy: {
    '/api': { 
      target: 'http://localhost:5000', 
      changeOrigin: true 
    }
  }
}
```

## API Reference

### Authentication Endpoints

<CodeGroup>
```http POST /api/auth/register
POST /api/auth/register
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "username": "testuser",
  "email": "test@example.com",
  "password": "password123",
  "firstName": "Test",
  "lastName": "User"
}

Response: 201 Created
{
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "user": {
    "id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "username": "testuser",
    "email": "test@example.com"
  }
}
```

```http POST /api/auth/login
POST /api/auth/login
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "email": "test@example.com",
  "password": "password123"
}

Response: 200 OK
{
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "user": {
    "id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "username": "testuser",
    "email": "test@example.com"
  }
}
```
</CodeGroup>

### Todo Endpoints

<CodeGroup>
```http GET /api/todos
GET /api/todos?filter=all|completed|pending&priority=high&category=work
Authorization: Bearer <token>

Response: 200 OK
[
  {
    "id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "title": "Complete project",
    "description": "Finish the new feature",
    "completed": false,
    "priority": "high",
    "dueDate": "2024-12-31T00:00:00.000Z",
    "tags": ["work", "important"],
    "category": "development",
    "status": "in-progress",
    "subtasks": []
  }
]
```

```http POST /api/todos
POST /api/todos
Authorization: Bearer <token>
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "title": "New Todo",
  "description": "Todo description",
  "priority": "high",
  "dueDate": "2024-12-31T00:00:00.000Z",
  "tags": ["work"],
  "category": "development"
}

Response: 201 Created
{
  "id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439012",
  "title": "New Todo",
  ...
}
```

```http PUT /api/todos/:id
PUT /api/todos/507f1f77bcf86cd799439011
Authorization: Bearer <token>
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "title": "Updated Todo",
  "completed": true
}

Response: 200 OK
{
  "id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
  "title": "Updated Todo",
  "completed": true,
  ...
}
```

```http DELETE /api/todos/:id
DELETE /api/todos/507f1f77bcf86cd799439011
Authorization: Bearer <token>

Response: 200 OK
{
  "message": "Todo deleted successfully"
}
```
</CodeGroup>

## Project Structure

```
fullstack-todo/
├── backend/
│   ├── src/
│   │   ├── config/
│   │   │   ├── database.js          # MongoDB connection
│   │   │   └── secrets-manager.js    # AWS Secrets Manager
│   │   ├── middleware/
│   │   │   ├── auth.js               # JWT authentication
│   │   │   ├── errorHandler.js       # Error handling
│   │   │   └── rateLimiter.js        # Rate limiting
│   │   ├── models/
│   │   │   ├── User.js               # User schema
│   │   │   └── Todo.js               # Todo schema
│   │   ├── routes/
│   │   │   ├── auth.js                # Auth routes
│   │   │   └── todos.js               # Todo routes
│   │   └── utils/
│   │       └── jwt.js                # JWT utilities
│   ├── server.js                     # Main server file
│   └── package.json
├── frontend/
│   ├── src/
│   │   ├── components/
│   │   │   ├── TodoList.jsx
│   │   │   ├── TodoForm.jsx
│   │   │   └── ThemeToggle.jsx
│   │   ├── context/
│   │   │   └── ThemeContext.jsx
│   │   ├── utils/
│   │   │   └── api.js
│   │   ├── App.jsx
│   │   └── main.jsx
│   ├── index.html
│   └── vite.config.js
└── database/
    └── migrations/                    # SQL migrations (if using PostgreSQL)
```

## Available Scripts

### Backend Scripts

```bash
npm start              # Start server
npm run dev            # Start with nodemon
npm test               # Run tests
npm run lint           # Lint code
```

### Frontend Scripts

```bash
npm run dev            # Start dev server
npm run build          # Build for production
npm run preview        # Preview production build
npm test               # Run tests
npm run lint           # Lint code
```

## Production Deployment

### MongoDB Atlas Setup

1. Create MongoDB Atlas cluster
2. Configure network access (whitelist IPs)
3. Get connection string
4. Store credentials in AWS Secrets Manager

### AWS Deployment

Follow the [Deployment Guide](/development/deployment) for:
- ECS Fargate deployment
- RDS or MongoDB Atlas setup
- CloudFront + S3 for frontend
- CI/CD pipeline setup

### Environment Configuration

Set production environment variables:
- `JWT_SECRET_ARN` - AWS Secrets Manager ARN
- `DB_SECRET_ARN` - AWS Secrets Manager ARN for database
- `AWS_REGION` - AWS region
- `SERVICE_NAME` - Service name for X-Ray tracing

```bash
npm test

# E2E tests
cd ../QAWolf-tests
npm test
```
